definition.description: Stores expense data for each user. Path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/expenses/{expenseId}`) ensures that only the authenticated user can access expenses under their ID, enabling secure list operations. Authorization Independence is achieved because expense documents are located under the user id in a hierarchy and ownership can be validated in rules without `get()` calls.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns the expense.

params.name: expenseId
params.description: The unique identifier for the expense document.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure, scalable, and easily maintainable data model for the SpendWise application, adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). The structure primarily leverages path-based ownership for user expenses, ensuring that only the authenticated user can access their own data. Authorization Independence is achieved because expense documents do not need to `get()` user documents to check authorization. QAPs are supported by segregating data based on user ownership, which allows for secure list operations using path-based rules. This design avoids complex rule logic and ensures that list operations are inherently secure. The timestamp field is included to enable ordered queries and chronological display of expenses.
